titleStmt.title: Press release regarding trip to California
titleStmt.author: Eartha M M White

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "editing the Earth M.M. White Archive" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

objectDesc.p: Hand written note regarding trip to California for the Colored Women's Club roughly 5 pages

body.p:
Citizens of Jacksonville
Both White and Colored honored Social Workersocial worker
with a Complimentarycomplimentary
trip to California to attend natnational meeting of C.W.C. at Oakland.
Miss Eartha Mary MagdelineMagdalene
White State Treasuser of the
Colored Womens Clubs of Fla.Colored Women's Clubs of Florida
Will leave on Tuesday, July 20th
stopingstopping at all the leading
places of interest. Miss White
and the late Mrs. Clara White her
mother (born at Fernandina, FlaFL) has given their
Jacksonville, Fla. entire lives for others.
The Old Home for the
aged colored peopleAged Colored People is
one of the many things
she established 26 ysyears ago
and is being successfully operated.

during the late World War
she served as State Chairman
of the Council of Defense
and will never be forgotten
for her excellent work.
Many of the splendid
things that the colored
people are now enjoying
have come through her
untiring efforts. The
first play groundplayground for colored
children came through an appeal
she made to the City Council
and receiving an appropriation
for the same. It was her
personal appeal to a
white friend who was an
early employer of her
mothersmother's the late Mr
Wilder that he bequeathed
to this city the large
track of land which will
be used for a beautiful colored
park.

onOn Friday the 1616th of July
she before leaving she
will as usual see what
the aged poor the blind of the city
and the orphan children
Jacksonville, Fla. have their Annual Beach
Outing and free dinner.
Courtesy through the Vice PresPresident
of the FlaFlorida East Coast Q R. G.
She has in 1910 U.S. CencusCensus Enumeration
and in 1926 city enumerator
and knows the condition of her
people well and is now
one of the directors of
the Negro Welfare League
and the only negra member
of the Negro businessBusiness League
and that only woman member
of B. Ministries Confference
of which she is assistant
Secretarysecretary Miss White was
born in this city near the
Cornercorner of Clay and Orange StsStreets
the only living child out of 13
children and though

She received special
training at Hampton VaHampton, VA
and Atlanta GaAtlanta, GA for War
Camp Community Service Work
and served for more than
two years as director of the
colored women and of colored
work at Savannah GaSavannah, GA.
Meeting with splendid
cooperation and success
returning to Jacksonville she
was employed by the county
as a Social Worker. afterAfter
the death of her mother
July 20, 1921 age 75. She for three
years was president and
manager of a steam laundry
giving employment to a
great of people. afterAfter selling
out Miss White became
a licensed Realestate Brokerreal estate broker
and has put over some
splendid deals was she

div.p:
she has treaded for the length
of the Atlantic and washed her
hands in the Gulf of Mexico:
and on her way to the Pacific
there is no place on earth
like dear of FlaFlorida.

body.note: The following is a card included with the letter.

div.p:
Institute on Race Relations
Washington, D.C.. March 51946
Received from: Eartha M. M. White, President
Clara White Mission
614 Ashley St.
Jacksonville, FLorida

[x] General Membership $1.00

Purchased by Prophet Joseph Rogers Lyon, M.S.
Thank you,
Lillian Hayman Kanegis, Treasurer
